results.title: Three colours white = Trois coleurs blanc (DVD)
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, CED, France 3 Cinema, CAB, Canal+, Marin Karmitz and Krzysztof Kieslowski
results.brief_description: The “Three Colours” trilogy is loosely inspired by the ideals of the French Revolution: Blue for freedom, Red for fraternity and White for equality. White also represents the hero’s marriage, the Polish winter and an alabaster bust that threads through the narrative, its significance unexplained. Karol is a Polish hairdresser in Paris. When his French wife divorces him he is left without money or possessions, except for a suitcase full of diplomas, a comb and a paper. A compatriot smuggles him home and his luck improves. Things have changed in the new democratic Poland. Janos becomes a successful businessman but must still resolve his relationship with his wife. Stars Zbigniew Zamachowski and Julie Delpy. Polish and French dialogue with English subtitles. Winner of the Silver Bear award for Best Director, Berlin, 1994.

results.title: Three colours red = Trois couleurs rouge [DVD]
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, France 3 Cinema, CAB Productions SA, TOR Film Studio, Canal+, Marin Karmitz and Krzysztof Kieslowski
results.brief_description: Three colours red is the last instalment in Krzysztof Kieslowski’s trilogy based on the three ideals of the French revolution - liberty, equality and fraternity, and was the unanimous choice of critics at the 1994 Cannes Film Festival. It is a film that returns to the director’s favourite theme of interconnectedness within an apparently haphazard world. Irene Jacob is fashion model Valentine whose life takes a seemingly random turn when she runs over a dog. She returns the injured animal to its indifferent owner, a world-weary judge (Jean-Louis Trintignant), who likes to listen in on neighbours phone conversations. Through this chance encounter, Kieslowski explores the impossibilities of justice as the judge re-examines old verdicts and tries to create order in other people’s messes. A parallel story-line involves a young man training to be a judge and his unfaithful girlfriend. As the stories unfold, it becomes increasingly evident they are linked on a far deeper level. This elaborate coda, in which life is seen as a set of pre-ordained events and consequences, culminates in a devastating denouement in which all previous characters from the trilogy are ironically united in tragedy in a truly haunting end to the director’s oeuvre. Co-starring Jean-Pierre Lorit and Frederique Feder. In French with English subtitles. Cinematography, Piotr Sobockinski. Editing, Jacques Witta. Music, Zbigniew Preisner. Screenplay, Krzysztof Piesiewicz and Krzysztof Kieslowski.

results.title: Three colours blue = Trois couleurs bleu [DVD]
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, CED, France 3 Cinema, CAB, TOR Film Studio, Canal+, Marin Karmitz and Krzysztof Kieslowski
results.brief_description: Three colours blue is the first installment in Krzysztof Kieslowski’s trilogy based on the three ideals of the French revolution - liberty, equality and fraternity. Blue addresses Liberty in an intimate manner. Julie, portrayed with refinement by Juliette Binoche is stripped of her emotional support at the onset of the film when her husband, Patrice, an internationally renowned composer, and her daughter, are killed in a car crash. Patrice’s work-in-progress, a concerto to celebrate Europe’s impending unification remains unfinished at his death. Her heartrending “freedom” provides the emotional centre of this hypnotic film. To deal with the trauma of their deaths, Julie retreats into anonymity, withdrawing from the world, but life can never be lived in a vacuum. Inexorably and inevitably, she begins to reawaken to life’s possibilities. Blue is a film of mood and atmosphere, shadow and light, music and gesture. It dazzles with its succinct emotional power, insights and technical genius - culminating, in the final moments, in an overwhelming spiritual climax. Co-starring Benoit Regent, Florence Pernel, Charlotte Very, Helene Vincent, Philippe Volter, Claude Duneton, Hugues Quester and Emmanuelle Riva. (Awards: Winner of the Venice 1993 Golden Lion - Best Actress and Best Picture, Los Angeles Critics Awards - Best Foreign Film, Runner Up - Best Music and 2 Cesar Awards including Best Actress). In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Those magnificent men in their flying machines or How I flew from London to Paris in 25 hours and 11 minutes
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Stan Margulies and Ken Annakin
results.brief_description: This farcical comedy based loosely on the historic 1910 London to Paris air race features the greatest aviators from around the world. They all come together when a stuffy, but very rich, newspaper publisher decides to sponsor an airplane race across the English Channel. The often hilarious escapades between the American, British, French, German, Italian and Japanese teams results in some of the most daring and hilarious in-flight acrobatics ever filmed.

results.title: Thoroughly modern Millie
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Ross Hunter Productions, Ross Hunter and George Roy Hill
results.brief_description: The Roaring Twenties come to life in this Academy Award winning musical starring Julie Andrews as the naive Millie, a country girl who comes to the big city in search of a husband. She befriends the sweet Miss Dorothy played by Mary Tyler Moore, fends off white slaver Mrs. Meers (Beatrice Lillie) and meets up with Muzzy played by Carol Channing who manages to solve all of Millie’s romantic problems which involve her boss (John Gavin) and paperclip salesman James Fox.

results.title: This is the army
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Hollywood House Video, Thirtieth Cemalux, Jack L. Warner, Hal Wallis and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: In World War I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In World War II his son Johnny Jones, previously his father’s assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called “This is the army”. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiance until the war is over. Cast includes George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Alan Hale, Kate Smith, and men from the armed forces including Ronald Reagan and Joe Louis. Based on the play by Irving Berlin, music and lyrics by Irving Berlin. Includes bonus blooper footage of Ronald Reagan in rehearsal. Note: “Copyright Thirtieth Cemalux Pty Ltd 1986”

results.title: This is spinal tap
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), Karen Murphy and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: Filmed as a documentary, this satire mimics a serious rock documentary with interviews, concert footage and glimpses of the day to day life of “Spinal Tap”. Christopher Guest, Michael McKean and Harry Shearer star as the band’s members, while Rob Reiner appears as the film maker (Marty Di Bergi). C0-starring Anjelica Huston and Billy Crystal.

results.title: This boy's life
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Regency Enterprises, Odyssey, Art Linson and Michael Caton-Jones
results.brief_description: This is the captivating true story based on the book by Tobias Wolff. Growing up is never easy but for Tobias Wolff (Leonardo DiCaprio) it’s sheer hell. His mother, Caroline (Ellen Barkin), has just married Dwight Hansen (Robert De Niro), a psychotic disciplinarian who rules with an iron fist and an explosive temper. Instead of the bright future his mother promised him, Tobias must now endure constant brutality from his sadistic stepfather. There is a way out though; and with the will to fight and courage way beyond his years, Tobias just might find it. An absorbing and thoughtful story is brought to life by the gripping performances of the stars.

results.title: Thirty two short films about Glenn Gould
results.creator_credit: Rhombus Media, Niv Fichman and Francois Girard
results.brief_description: Thirty two short films about Glenn Gould is an inventive and playful film that seeks to portray the genius, complex and eccentric personality of legendary pianist, Glenn Gould. The film borrows its structure from JS Bach’s Goldberg Variations (and name from Beethoven’s “32 variations in C Minor”), and juxtaposes 32 short vignettes to portray the broadly influenced Gould. The film uses a combination of interview, dramatisation and animation, punctuated with the music of Gould’s live performances (mostly Bach, Beethoven and Shoenberg) to humorously fill the portrait of Gould. Included is an excerpt from Norman McLaren’s experimental animation ‘Spheres’ and Gould’s live radio broadcast of 28th December 1967, ‘The Idea of North’. Peppered throughout are Gould’s philosophical ruminations such as, “for every hour you spend with people you need x more hours on your own”.

results.title: Thirty seconds over Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Sam Zimbalist
results.brief_description: Spencer Tracy, Van Johnson and Robert Mitchum in his first leading role star in this classic World War II thriller based on the real-life diary of an American pilot (Ted Lawson) who was involved in the first American air raids on Japan. Lieutenant Colonel James Doolittle (Spencer Tracy) is the tough and inspiring mastermind of the historic crew of the “Ruptured Duck”, commanded by Captain Ted Lawson (Van Johnson). Lawson’s daydreams of the bride he left behind are intertwined with the nightmarish terrors of a tense Pacific crossing, thunderous bombings and the fate of his men. This is not only an action filled, emotional, historical saga of the war in the Pacific but also a romantic tale of American patriotism at its best.
